result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather M Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bond of $150.00 applied, leaving a balance of $180.50.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: FINAL ORDER
Plea Diversion Final Report
Final Order

9:30 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Brian Mares.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court regarding the DPA.  Statement by ADA.  Statement by Atty Mares, defendant will agree to extend the DPA to after the trial on the other case. 

Court adjourned at 9:32 a.m.
Objection to Revocation of Diversion Agreement (Defendant's)
to Revoke the Plea Diverson Agreement
of hearing held on January 15, 2016, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Brenda L. Sosinsky - Court Reporter
of hearing held on January 12, 2016, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Brenda L. Sosinsky - Court Reporter
PLEA DIVERSION AGREEMENT - for a period of 12 months.

1:16 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Brian Mares.  Lisa Vanden Branden Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Mares recites agreement, defendant will plea NO CONTEST to count 1 and enter into a plea diversion agreement and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in and State will read-in a referral from Berlin Police for Interference with child custody from 01/06/2016.  Statement by ADA - recites conditions of the Plea Diversion Agreement.  Atty Mares concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as domestic.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in and reads-in the referral from BPD from 01/06/2016.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be withheld pending compliance with the terms of the plea diversion agreement.  ADA confirms compliance with the victim witness rights.  Court approves the plea diversion agreement.

Court adjourned ast 1:23 p.m.

12:22 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Brian Mares present via telephone.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Mares - conversation earlier with ADA, offer has been made and the defendant will accept.  Court questions Atty Mares regarding offer from the ADA.  Statement by Atty Mares - defendant will accept as offered by the State.

Court cancels the jury trial and sets for plea and sentencing on January 15, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 12:25 p.m.
Defendant's (FAX COPY)
No notices mailed.  Notice delivered to DA.
Jury status hearing at 01-12-2016 11:45 am
of hearing held on August 4, 2015, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Jill M. Bartol - Court Reporter

3:31 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Brian Mares.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by ADA.  

OTHER ACTS EVIDENCE - Statement by Atty Mares.  Statement by the Court.  Argument by ADA - states reasons and objects.  Court denies the motion but will allow a general statement.

Court adjourned at 3:58 a.m.
Offer of Proof of Other Acts Evidence
Jury trial - 12 person at 01-14-2016 08:15 am
Motion hearing at 10-13-2015 03:30 pm

4:03 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Brian Mares.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Mares - have not been able to resolve this and requests a trial date.  ADA has filed standard motions.  Both counsel agree - nothing to address. 

Other Acts 

Statement by State - opposes this.  Statement by Atty Mares.  Court limits this to the agreement of December 24th.  Atty Mares to get the court specifics to develop a pattern.

Prohibit in reference to victim

Statement by Atty Mares.  Statement by ADA - nothing more than whats is the brief.  Court denies this motion.

Court sets for Jury Trial on January 14, 2016 and January 15, 2016 and Motion Hearing on October 13, 2015 at 3:30 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 4:18 p.m.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion in Support of his Motion in Limine to Prohibit Reference to "Victim"

Court questions Atty Mares regarding motions.  Court will set for Motion Hearing on August 4, 2015 at 3:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 3:34 p.m.

1:30 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Atty Brian Mares present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Mares confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Mares enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $150.00 Cash bond and conditions of:  No Violent contact with Andrew P.   Court will set for Status Hearing on April 13, 2015 at 3:00 p.m.  Defendant to sign bond within one week.
